data.title: γ Sextantis (gamma Sextantis) - Star in Sextans
data.meta_description: γ Sextantis is a multiple main-sequence star of magnitude 5.05 in the constellation of Sextans. Find complete information about γ Sextantis on TheSkyLive.com.
data.text:
γ Sextantis (gamma Sextantis)

γ Sextantis is a multiple main-sequence star of spectral class A1 in the constellation of Sextans.

γ Sextantis visual magnitude is 5.05. Because of its faintness, γ Sextantis is visible to the naked eye only from locations with very dark skies, while it is not visible at all from skies affected by light pollution.

Celestial Coordinates

Apparent

Right Ascension 09h 53m 43s

Declination -08° 13’ 17”

Hour Angle 04h 21m 34s

Sideral Time 14h 15m 17s

J2000

Right Ascension 09h 52m 30s

Declination -08° 06’ 18”

Galactic Latitude 34.17°

Color ⬤

Spectral Type A1V

Temperature 9652K

The red dot in the diagram below shows where γ Sextantis is situated in the Hertzsprung–Russell diagram.

Star System Properties

γ Sextantis is a visual double star which can be observed only with the help of very large telescopes. The table below shows key information about the γ Sextantis double sysyem:

Main star magnitude 5.05

Secondary star magnitude 5.55

Magnitude difference 0.5

Separation 0.4 arcsec

Distance, Radial Speed, Proper Motion

γ Sextantis is distant 261.43 light years from the Sun and it is moving far from the Sun at the speed of 12 kilometers per second.

Distance (parsec) 80.19

Distance (light year) 261.43

Radial Speed 12 km/s

Proper Motion RA -0.055 arcsec/y

Proper Motion Dec -0.04"/y
